Datatable.LocalizationPair: Leading as Example
As an example to others the hero inspires those that he leads to do more for less.
Commander of Great Battles
Willing to fight the longest, most drawn out battles, the hero maximises the potential before the first gun is shot.
Sign of Progress
As a symbol of personal and societal groth, the hero leads to others following suite.
Trustworthy Contacts
A hero of sufficient fame gains admireres and fans among all parts of society. Some of these can provide access to goods otherwise hard to get.
Commander of great Fleets
A distinguished commander, even among others can often control even more ships at sufficient levels to outmaneuvre his enemies.
Killer of Fiends
A hero is there to hunt dragons, kill monsters and protect the innocent. This one excells at the first two.
Save and sound
Experience in all political matters leads to plans that are nearly impossible to prevent from coiming to fruition.
A Voice to charm
Combining natural abilities and years of training with some well written speaches can raise armies and win wars without a shot being fired.
Optimized Bookkeeping
A few selective redistributions here, a few rarely used laws there and somehow there are resources out of nothing - or so it seems.
Taxes and Returns
Optimizing the local tax system leads to way smaller losses to oil the wheels, increasing the profits in the end.
Commander of well trained ships
A commander is never better than the weakest link in his staff. This one took it too heart, forging the strongest possible weak link.
All power to shields
Forgoing offence, this commander focusses on survival. After all, a dead ally won't be able to shoot anyone, right?
